trustfund:
TF051243-GEF2:SOUTH AFRICA-CAPE ACTION
            PLAN FOR THE ENVIRONMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental and social
            management framework for South Africa's Cape Action
            Plan for the Environment Project, which is a large-scale,
            multi-faceted GEF funded conservation program aiming to
            conserve, restore, and enhance biodiversity in the Cape
            Floral Kingdom and the adjacent marine environment, and
            deliver significant economic benefits to the region. The
            report identifies potential impacts from project activities
            consolidating key protected areas, such as socio-economic
            impacts due to restricted/loss of access to resources
            (affecting communities impacted by the mega reserve process;
            loss of agricultural land or productivity; impacts
            associated with the upgrading or construction of
            infrastructure (linked to tourism development or the
            development of small and medium enterprises); and management
            plans for the estuaries that involve developing
            infrastructure in the (unlikely) event that rivers are
            diverted or weirs constructed. Only project activities
            related to developing infrastructure for an extensive
            concessioning program for eco-tourism facilities and
            services in protected areas will also  trigger the
            environmental assessment process (EIAs). Infrastructure
            would include roads, sewage treatment works, al structures
            below the high water mark (HWM), dams, reservoirs, schemes
            for bulk water supply, and waste disposal would require
            EIAs. Activities such as land reclamation below the HWM,
            changes in land use, and any anticipated damage to natural
            habitats and cultural property will also require EIAs.
